Hmm… my CI process that uses `drpcli contents bundle` has started failing with `Error: Failed to load: No idea how to decode FETCH_HEAD into .git`
(first rebuild of the content pack in ~2 weeks so it’s pulled down a new version of drp + cli (its configured to use tip)
bundle checks for ._[meta].meta files.
it's possible that you've got a .git file hanging out in a subdirectory (likely the templates one)
<@UBXEU90UQ> RE: <https://github.com/digitalrebar/provision/blob/9d70a4999bc6890063a18a7a395f0e9580127ec2/api/content.go#L117>

attachments.title: digitalrebar/provision
attachments.text: Digital Rebar Provision is a simple and powerful Golang executable that provides a complete API-driven DHCP/PXE/TFTP provisioning system. - digitalrebar/provision

text: hmm… well it is a git repo so it has a `.git` dir in the root
which would explain the error, as FETCH_HEAD is a file inside that
yeah, removing the `.git` dir before calling bundle works
we put multiple content packs in a repo, so that file is not a factor

(Apparently it's that time of day, when I turn up after reading things.) The gateway around here is always the bottom of an ip range and I've calculated that using ruby. Is there a way of adding some dynamic calculation to a content pack or the inside of a template?
(<https://golang.org/pkg/text/template/> but I'm not sure how much I can cram in a template.)
That is, I know how I would do the calculation, I'm not sure where I would add this in a content pack.
<@UDPKKMNMQ> yes!  we include the sprig library for the template render, so you can use nearly any of those functions
Thank you! Reading about sprig.
<https://provision.readthedocs.io/en/tip/doc/arch/provision.html?highlight=sprig>

and a FAQ example:
<https://provision.readthedocs.io/en/tip/doc/faq-troubleshooting.html?highlight=sprig#how-can-i-manipulate-values-during-golang-template-rendering>
you may also add a task to calculate and push the values into params for later stages.
Okay, I think I get it. Back to the books. Very much appreciated.
